summary: Build a premium, modern, professional static website for the luxury men’s grooming brand “Mr Black Salon” (Indian audience), with 5 pages (Home, About, Services, Gallery, Contact), WhatsApp/Call CTAs, responsive UI, SEO, and Netlify-ready deployment (no backend/payment/login).
architectural_notes: Static website only: no backend, no login, no payment gateway, no online booking (CTAs via WhatsApp/phone only).
Tech stack: modern HTML/CSS/JS or React (Vite); code should be clean, reusable, well-structured.
Performance & SEO: fast-loading, SEO meta tags, optimized images.
Responsive design required for mobile and desktop.
Services page should include an image (or placeholder) for every listed service type/category, not only a small highlighted subset.

existing_features.title: Implement a fully static, fast-loading, responsive website for the men’s grooming brand “Mr Black Salon” with 5 pages: Home, About Us, Services, Gallery, and Contact.

Apply a premium, modern visual theme consistent across the site using a black/charcoal base with gold accents, ultra-clean typography, consistent spacing/alignment, and a luxury men’s salon aesthetic suitable for an Indian audience.

Build the Home page with a hero section featuring the headline “Premium Grooming for the Modern Gentleman” and prominent CTA buttons for (1) Book Appointment (WhatsApp) and (2) Call Now; include smooth, elegant animations/transitions (fade/slide/hover) without hurting performance.
Create the About Us page with a short brand story emphasizing professionalism, hygiene, and a premium grooming experience; include trust-building content tailored to local customers.

Create the Services page with categories (Hair Services, Beard & Shave, Facial & Skin Care, Premium Grooming Packages), show prices, and use a clean card-based layout; highlight main services (Haircut, Facial, Beard, Hair Spa) with images and include WhatsApp/Call CTAs (no online booking).

Create the Gallery page as an Instagram-style responsive image grid using placeholder images and a structure that makes it easy to replace images later (e.g., a single data array or folder-based mapping).

Create the Contact page showing the business address and clickable Phone/WhatsApp buttons for all provided numbers; embed a Google Map for Maduranthakam location; include an Instagram profile link to https://www.instagram.com/mr.black4473.
Add a floating WhatsApp action button site-wide and add a mobile-only sticky call button (or equivalent prominent mobile CTA) that initiates a call to a provided number.
Add a footer with social links (at minimum Instagram) and include consistent site navigation/branding elements across pages (header/nav + footer).

Implement SEO essentials: unique page titles, meta descriptions, canonical (if appropriate), Open Graph/Twitter preview tags, and structured, accessible headings; ensure good Lighthouse-style basics (responsive meta viewport, alt text, semantic landmarks).

Optimize performance for a static deployment: use compressed/optimized images, lazy-load non-critical images (e.g., gallery), and ensure the build is ready for static hosting (e.g., Netlify) including SPA routing configuration if client-side routing is used.
Ensure the site contains no payment, login, booking system, or backend-dependent features; all CTAs must route only to WhatsApp, phone calls, or external Instagram.
Add and use generated static image assets (logo + premium placeholders) by placing them in frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the UI.

Ensure every service item displayed on the Services page has an associated image by adding image paths for all services in frontend/src/data/services.ts (not only the currently featured 4–5 services).
Add new premium, consistent-style service images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the corresponding services in frontend/src/data/services.ts.
